DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Target Volume Administered Planning Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the planned targeted volume (PTV) of tissues included in a patient's radiation therapy treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the number of planning target volume planned for a patient's radiation therapy treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The goal intended to be attained.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the planning target volume?
